description: Effective documentation patterns learned from successful documents

patterns.description: Describe what success looks like, not how to build it
patterns.example: Instead of 'Implement adapter pattern with 5 provider classes', write 'Users can authenticate via any supported identity provider'
patterns.rationale: SynthAI expanded 40x because specs described implementation. Outcome focus enables minimal implementations.

patterns.description: Include only what the reader needs to accomplish their goal
patterns.example: For a simple API: Overview (purpose), Authentication (if needed), 2-3 Core Endpoints. Skip rate limiting, changelog, and edge cases until needed.
patterns.rationale: More documentation is more to maintain, review, and become stale. Minimal docs serve readers better.

patterns.description: Each section should justify its existence for the target audience
patterns.example: Before adding 'Alternatives Considered', ask: Were alternatives actually considered? Will readers benefit from this?
patterns.rationale: Sections added 'just in case' create bloat without value.

patterns.description: Document common error responses with examples and recovery steps
patterns.example: Document errors users are likely to encounter (400, 401, 404). Skip rare internal errors until they appear in support requests.
patterns.note: Reduced from 0.90 - exhaustive error docs often unnecessary

patterns.description: Start with simple use cases, progressively reveal advanced features
patterns.example: Begin with 'Quick Start' for basic usage, then 'Common Tasks', then 'Advanced Configuration'

patterns.description: Document architectural decisions using ADR (Architecture Decision Record) format
patterns.example: Structure as: Context -> Decision -> Consequences. Include date, status (proposed/accepted/deprecated), and decision drivers

patterns.description: Show representative request/response pairs for API endpoints
patterns.example: Show one clear curl command with the most important headers, followed by a success response. Add error case only if non-obvious.
patterns.note: Reduced from 0.95 - one good example beats exhaustive examples

patterns.description: Define technical terms on first use, link to glossary
patterns.example: On first mention: 'The **endpoint** (a URL path that accepts requests) handles authentication...'

patterns.description: Include at least one architecture diagram for system designs
patterns.example: Use Mermaid diagrams for component relationships, sequence diagrams for flows

patterns.description: Structure troubleshooting as symptom -> cause -> solution
patterns.example: Create a table: | Symptom | Possible Cause | Solution | with the most common issues first

patterns.description: Use tables for parameters when there are 3 or more
Use C4 model hierarchy (Context, Container, Component) with dedicated Mermaid diagram for each level
patterns.example: Start with System Context showing external actors/systems, then Container diagram showing deployable units, then Component diagram showing internal modules

patterns.description: Include coverage summary for complex systems with many test cases
patterns.example: Simple table showing requirements mapped to test coverage. Only needed for complex systems.
patterns.note: Reduced from 0.92 - detailed matrices often unnecessary for simple features

patterns.description: Use diagrams to clarify complex architectures when needed
patterns.example: One clear diagram showing key relationships. Multiple layered diagrams only for enterprise systems.
patterns.note: Reduced from 0.95 - single clear diagram often sufficient

patterns.description: Structure How-To guides with explicit Goal statement, numbered Steps with embedded code, and Expected Result section
patterns.example: **Goal:** Submit a well-documented bug report... #### Steps 1. Search existing issues... #### Expected Result Maintainers can reproduce within 24 hours.

patterns.description: Structure problem statements with Current State, Pain Points (by persona), Impact, and measurable Success Criteria
patterns.example: ### Current State [description] ### Pain Points **For Quality Assurance:** ... **For Development Teams:** ... ### Impact [consequences] ### Success Criteria - [ ] Measurable criterion 1

patterns.description: Document module APIs using tables with Function, Parameters, Returns, and Description columns
patterns.example: | Function | Parameters | Returns | Description | |----------|------------|---------|-------------| | main() | None (uses sys.argv) | None | Entry point |

patterns.description: Document state machine transitions with Entry state, Exit state, and data changes for each phase/module
patterns.example: **State Transitions:** - Entry: No state or minimal state with `adw_id` - Exit: State includes `worktree_path`, `backend_port`, `frontend_port`...
